text: it's becoming more desperate in a sense
I think a lot of the people there from
Syria are wondering if this is going to
be where they spend the rest of their
lives
I'm Lucien Perkins I'm a photographer
and filmmaker in Washington DC I
traveled to Jordan with the Center for
the Prevention of genocide which is a
part of the United States Holocaust
Memorial Museum and we traveled to
Jordan to basically have a first-hand
look at the Syrian refugee crisis there
we traveled to saturate refugee camp
which now has a hundred thousand
refugees it's the fourth largest city in
Jordan it was built for 50,000 refugees
and at one point was close to 120,000 I
will say that compared to other refugee
camps that I've been to it's very well
maintained by both the UNHCR and the
Jordanian government but a refugee camp
is a refugee camp and many of them now
have been there for one to two years
we then went to the border of Jordan and
Syria and the day that we were there a
thousand refugees crossed they reminded
me of similar circumstances that I
documented before for example the war in
Kosovo their day that I arrived there
fifteen thousand refugees were stuck at
the border many of them had the same
shocked expression of the day before we
were at home eating dinner with our
families now were thrust out of our
country and many of them have at this
stage have no idea what their future is
going to be for them or their families
the last night that I was there I spent
time with the family they sold their car
came to Jordan with their life savings
but within a year all that money's gone
you know when they lived in Syria he
witnessed a neighbor's children getting
killed
I saw them bring the bodies at home the
girls were raped they were stabbed he
had to bury them and he said I don't
want this to happen to my daughters so
they fled but their typical of the
families that do come into Jordan
Lebanon Turkey and Iraq from Syria
they've lost everything
they've trying to figure out a way to
salvage the lives that their children
have lost educate them and just put food
on the table
